Posts.Content: [QUOTE=ASAdvocate;315953]Gunrun, I'm glad to hear that you changed doctors. Recommending surgery for a one percent G3+4 seems very drastic and unnecessary. However, while the MRI can detect areas of interest for a biopsy, it cannot, at this time, classify the grade of cancer. For example, I have a PIRADS 4 lesion. Sounds serious, right? But, it is almost all HGPIN, with less than 5 percent G3+3 cancer. FIVE biopsies to prove that! So, just keep going slow and accumulate the pathology data and knowledge that you need. You may want to add your birth year to your signature. Good luck.[/QUOTE I think this is to rule out immediate surgery. I will add DOB. He even mentioned an MRI biopsy if anything shows. I like this guy a lot better than the other let's take it out guy.
Posts.Signature: DOB 4/1970 5/24/16. Psa 4.9 7/1/16. Psa 6.9 7/8/16 Psa 5.7 freePSA 11%. Did this on my own Dr never asked for Fpsa Don't know why, he should of being a urologist. 7/22/16 biopsy with 12 specimen taken 7/28/16 results 1 core with 1% Gleason 3+4. Dr recommends surgery Consult today will speak to him and try get report. 8/3/2016 second pathology Gleason 6. Dr said do a Psa in Oct , 3 months After biopsy. I'm going to a new Dr Aug 19. 8/19/2016 1 1/2 hour wait to see new Dr , he said MRI then see. Dr MIrza/Dr Thrasher at KUMED. Thrasher taught Mirza. 9/20/2016 MRI finds lesion right side. PSA is 9. Waiting for fusion biopsy On right lesion , or go into surgery will discuss with Dr. 10/2016. Fusion biopsy finds no cancer. PSA again in Jan 2017 1/2017. PSA 2.12 lowest its ever been 5/2017. PSA now 1.5. Turkey tail mushroom is all I take. Hmm.
Posts.Title: My update

Posts.Content: After seeing my new Surgeon/urologist today at KUMED I feel more confidant. He said you have a very slow cancer and at my age he said let's do an MRI to rule out any higher cancer Gleason 8+ I assume and take it from there. He has done 100's of Dacinci and he is not pushing me into surgery like my original urologist who has done I bet less than 100. If there is no higher cancer shown he might offer WW. He also said the Gleason 6 and 7 might not even show on the Mri. We are looking for a higher cancer which the biopsy did not get. I agree with him. And I thought I was walking out with a surgery day. So sept 17 is MRI and sept 20'is result day.

Posts.Title: My update

Posts.Content: MRI found a lesion on the right side of Prostate. Kind of a set back because i was going to due watchful waiting. Dr said Gleason 6 on left side did not show because it is a 6. Now for the right side he said 80% chance of being a high grade cancer and it was a Pyrade 4 ( spelling error I am sure) so he asked me either take it Out of fusion biopsy on right side. I picked the biopsy so I have to wait till Nov 1 to get me in. I do have a copy of the MRI if anymore information you guys want may help in advice. I assume the lesion cannot be benign? Wishful thinking.

Has anyone tried eating fish and stop eating red meat and hot dogs and Bologne and such? I was thinking of trying it. He also says smokers can get the faster worse cancer I guess a higher Gleason score and I am a smoker but have Gleason 6 and 7 from 2 different pathologists.

Posts.Title: Food and cancer

Posts.Content: I don't really think about it much. My psa is high at 46 I was crushed but when my 3+4 was downgraded to 3+3 from bostwick I was relieved. After another biopsy on Oct which found no cancer I was happier than shit. Psa test again in Jan to find out where I am at. If it's high then possibly another biopsy? Don't know. But my first Dr wanted surgery right away. Then I went to kansas cancer urology hospital and they took over. MRI showed a lesion hence the second biopsy in Oct and he took 18 specimen in the lesion in the left side of prostate where the original cancer found and found nothing. Yes I have cancer but I hope it's not that large. More to come in Jan.

Posts.Content: Psa 6.9 free Fpsa 11% Biopsy results yesterday from 12 cores? 1 core positive 1% Gleason 7 Sent to secondary pathologist for opinion. Going into Dr office today for consult. I'm 46 with 4 young kids so I have to treat this aggressively. Dr said it's possible he might Of missed other tumors or the tumor he found possibly just nicked it and could be more Than 1%. I will try and copy my pathologist report today. Anyone from Missouri know a good Dr for surgery?

Posts.Title: Need to decide - what would you do and why did you choose it?

Posts.Content: Can you send his info to me? I am at my urologists office now waiting for the consult thanks. Originally Posted by OP Rob Go to KU Med. They're the only National Cancer Institute designated facility in town. Tell them you want Dr. J. Brantley Thrasher. He does four or five DaVinci's a week - at least the did in 2013, and has been doing them a looong time. Great guy, outstanding surgeon. My pathology was similar to yours, and PSA remains undetectable three years out. As he was excising my prostate he noticed it was leaking urine, which is odd to say the least. Turns out my left kidney has two ureters, one of which had attached itself to the prostate rather than the bladder. So he "simply" made an opening in the bladder and stitched it in place. So I got to spend two night rather than one. It's a big practice, but Thrasher's THE guy.

Posts.Content: Psa 6.9 free Fpsa 11% Biopsy results yesterday from 12 cores? 1 core positive 1% Gleason 7 Sent to secondary pathologist for opinion. Going into Dr office today for consult. I'm 46 with 4 young kids so I have to treat this aggressively. Dr said it's possible he might Of missed other tumors or the tumor he found possibly just nicked it and could be more Than 1%. I will try and copy my pathologist report today. Anyone from Missouri know a good Dr for surgery?

Posts.Title: Just got the bad news

Posts.Content: Can you send his info to me? I am at my urologists office now waiting for the consult thanks. Originally Posted by OP Rob Go to KU Med. They're the only National Cancer Institute designated facility in town. Tell them you want Dr. J. Brantley Thrasher. He does four or five DaVinci's a week - at least the did in 2013, and has been doing them a looong time. Great guy, outstanding surgeon. My pathology was similar to yours, and PSA remains undetectable three years out. As he was excising my prostate he noticed it was leaking urine, which is odd to say the least. Turns out my left kidney has two ureters, one of which had attached itself to the prostate rather than the bladder. So he "simply" made an opening in the bladder and stitched it in place. So I got to spend two night rather than one. It's a big practice, but Thrasher's THE guy.
Posts.Signature: DOB 4/1970 5/24/16. Psa 4.9 7/1/16. Psa 6.9 7/8/16 Psa 5.7 freePSA 11%. Did this on my own Dr never asked for Fpsa Don't know why, he should of being a urologist. 7/22/16 biopsy with 12 specimen taken 7/28/16 results 1 core with 1% Gleason 3+4. Dr recommends surgery Consult today will speak to him and try get report. 8/3/2016 second pathology Gleason 6. Dr said do a Psa in Oct , 3 months After biopsy. I'm going to a new Dr Aug 19. 8/19/2016 1 1/2 hour wait to see new Dr , he said MRI then see. Dr MIrza/Dr Thrasher at KUMED. Thrasher taught Mirza. 9/20/2016 MRI finds lesion right side. PSA is 9. Waiting for fusion biopsy On right lesion , or go into surgery will discuss with Dr. 10/2016. Fusion biopsy finds no cancer. PSA again in Jan 2017 1/2017. PSA 2.12 lowest its ever been 5/2017. PSA now 1.5. Turkey tail mushroom is all I take. Hmm.

Posts.Title: Just got the bad news

Posts.Content: Send the pathology out for a second opinion. I'm also Gleason 6 and 46yo. Read my threads. I'm not jumping into anything and almost did. my Dr says let's see what Mri says. I was Gleason 7 then second opinion pathology said Gleason 6. Although my Cancer was found in 1 code with 1%. I dropped my first Dr because he wanted surgery and didn't even want to an MRI. If my MRI shows nothing then I will wait till psa rises. If it shows more cancer then I will have surgery.
